name: 李鎮宇
objective: This class covers media and communications with an emphasis on consumers. Students will learn about marketing, branding, advertising, and media strategy, including practical problem-solving and analysis skills.
schedule:
Week 1	Introduction to global marketing communications  
Week 2   Global brand identity and positioning
Week 3   Values and culture
Week 4   Dimensions of culture
Week 5   Consumer behaviour
Week 6   Researching and applying culture values in advertisement design
Week 7   Integrated communication
Week 8   Culture and media
Week 9   Midterm exam week
Week 10 Advertising appeals
Week 11 Executional styles
Week 12 From value paradox to strategy
Week 13 Digital and social media marketing
Week 14 Advertising tools
Week 15 Building brands through experiential marketing
Week 16 Promotional tools (corporate communications, PR, sales promotion, direct marketing)
Week 17 Review of the content / Revision
Week 18 Final Exam week
scorePolicy:
32.5% Homework and Quizzes
32.5% Midterm
35.0% Final Project
100% Total
materials:
Title: “Global Marketing & Advertising：Understanding Cultural Paradoxes”
Author: Marieke de Mooij
Edition: 5th or 6th
